messages.content: ComfyUI-Color_Transfer is used for implementing color transfer using the KMeans algorithm in ComfyUI.
ComfyUI-Color_Transfer can be installed by cloning the repository into the custom_nodes folder, using the command: `git clone https://github.com/45uee/ComfyUI-Color_Transfer.git`.
What are the inputs needed for the ComfyUI-Color_Transfer nodes?
The inputs for the ComfyUI-Color_Transfer nodes are the image and the color palette. The color palette must be defined in the format [(Value, Value, Value), ...].
How do you create a color palette in ComfyUI-Color_Transfer?
To create a color palette in ComfyUI-Color_Transfer, you need to create a "Color Palette" node and define the color values in the format [(Value, Value, Value), ...].
How can you use the ComfyUI-Color_Transfer nodes?

To use the ComfyUI-Color_Transfer nodes, first create a "Color Palette" node with your desired colors defined in the format [(Value, Value, Value), ...]. Then, create a "Palette Transfer" node, connect your image and palette as input.
Provide an example of a color palette for the "Color Palette" node of ComfyUI-Color_Transfer.
An example color palette for the "Color Palette" node could be [(30, 32, 30), (60, 61, 55), (105, 117, 101), (236, 223, 204)].
Explain the image output after running the ComfyUI-Color_Transfer nodes.
The image output after running the ComfyUI-Color_Transfer nodes will be the original image transferred with the colors from the specified palette.
